result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Matthew Micek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 7 days RCJ in lieu of costs. Concurrent with 83 day sentence.

With huber- May work outside of Rock County.

Stayed-Defendant to call Diversion Office 373-3880 M-F 7am-3pm within 72 working hours or by 5-17-16  for report date within 75 days or no later than 7-15-16. Failure to do so will result in issuance of a commitment to jail without huber privileges and new criminal charges.

Defendant Eric Matthew Micek in court with attorney Walter H Isaacson.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Guilty plea entered, court finds guilty. Defendant Eric Matthew Micek in court with attorney Walter H Isaacson.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Jury selection scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Calendar call on May 5, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Eric Matthew Micek in court in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson.  Katharine Buker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. $100.00 cash bond set. Not Guilty plea entered by defendant.
